alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Northern Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 8:21PM MST until January 20 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 11 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, wet snow transitioning to a wintry mix expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Central and Southeast Phillips and Northern Phillips Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 2 PM to 11 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as snow Thursday afternoon, then transition to a mix of snow and freezing rain by early Thursday evening, then to a mix of rain and snow late Thursday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Northern Phillips
